title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good with a couple of flaws
author: CTM
content: I love TWS earbuds. I have many including buds from Sony, Samsung, AKG, Amazon, Soundpeats and more. I was intrigued by small size of the 1More Minis and wanted to try them. For the most part, they are wonderful. They are literally half the size of my other buds with most of the same features. Remarkable. I don't really like large buds hanging out of my ears and really loathe the stemmed variety like Airpods. These minis almost disappear and their extremely light weight makes them very comfortable. The sound is really good, they have very decent ANC and transparency modes, they have in ear detection and an app for some customization. I have no idea how they can manage to squeeze all of these features into such a small bud. On top of the features, the buds last 5 hours with ANC and 6 hours without. Amazing. I would unconditionally recommend these buds except for two annoyances that EVERY YouTube reviewer has complained about. First, limited customization of tap controls. These don't have single tap capability. I understand that to some degree because the buds are so small that it would probably be impossible to reposition them without stopping or starting your music. The bigger problem is 1More's use of Sound ID rather than "real" equalizer controls. Sound ID works by offering A/B samples that you select and it creates a profile based on your selections. It's horrible and doesn't work at all for me. I tried it at least 10 times and the Sound ID profile was always worse than the out of the box sound. I have been forced to use third part equalizers on my phone to get them to sound the way I want. 1More, if you want to keep your Sound ID, please add some presets and a manual equalizer the way many others do like Soundcore for example. I dislike Sound ID so much that it prevented me from buying their new EVO buds. I had the buds in my cart and then cancelled the order. The EVO cost more than the mini and I simply didn't want to deal with Sound ID again. If 1More adds equalization and perhaps allows for more tap options, these buds would be fantastic. As it is, I really like them and will workaround the app shortcomings. 1More, if you are listening, I know you can fix these problems. You can make a great product even greater!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2022
product_name: 1MORE ComfoBuds Mini Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Earbuds

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars I wish I could rate 5 stars, butâ€¦
author: Gianna
content: â€¦I just canâ€™t. Because as useful as these earbuds are, thereâ€™s one huge caveat to them that needs to be made clear.Letâ€™s start with the positive: the ComfoBuds Mini are incredible for sleeping. While theyâ€™re not advertised as sleep buds, I find it hard to believe that they werenâ€™t designed with sleep in mind. The flat shape, the small size, the selection of noise-blocking ambient sounds included in the app, even a sleep timerâ€¦while you certainly CAN use them as everyday buds (and if you have very small ears, you might want to) these are clearly intended for being comfortable enough to wear at night and block out unwanted noises. I love them for that. I previously hated wearing noise-cancelling earbuds at night, which was somewhat of a necessity to me due to my wifeâ€™s snoring problem; with these buds, I ditched the discomfort and pain and accidental button triggering in favor of a much more comfortable experience, to the point where I actually enjoyed putting them in every night. Theyâ€™re not called the â€œComfoBudsâ€ for nothing.The ANC is not the best Iâ€™ve ever tried, but gets the job done as far as helping to seal out those pesky nighttime disruptions. Sound quality is admittedly not the greatest. Donâ€™t get me wrong, itâ€™s perfectly acceptable, it just suffers in a few areas that probably directly relate to the size of the buds. Soundstage is poor, instrument separation is very poor, and the volume tends to skew on the quiet side, but if youâ€™re using these for sleep, none of that matters too much.Now here comes the real caveat.1MORE is clearly having a serious quality control issue with the ComfoBuds mini. I canâ€™t say for certain whether this extends to their other models, as this is the only product of theirs Iâ€™ve tried. And while the idea is fantastic and theyâ€™ve clearly put a lot of effort into the design of these buds, thereâ€™s a persistent issue with one or both earbuds suddenly losing its noise-cancelling ability after a very short period of time, producing whooshing or roaring noises instead of blocking sound.â€œItâ€™s just earwax blocking up the buds!â€ insist the apologist reviewers, as well as 1MORE themselves. â€œClean them and theyâ€™ll be fine!â€ But I beg to differ. With my first pair of these, the whooshing started in the right earbud after about two months of use. I immediately followed every bit of advice I could find about cleaning them, to no avail. I thought, okay, thatâ€™s a bummer, and I sent them back and ordered another pair. The left earbud of the second pair started whooshing within two weeks. I repeat: TWO WEEKS. I had used them less than ten times since I got them, plus I was being very careful about cleaning my ears every day, so there is NO WAY that they accumulated enough earwax during that time to block them up. Something else is going on. I wonder if trying to cram so much tech into such a small package is backfiring, and the components are interfering with each other somehow. Maybe thatâ€™s why you donâ€™t normally see ANC in buds of this size.1MORE will replace malfunctioning buds for you, but the process does take a while, and youâ€™ll be without them in the meantime. It seems theyâ€™re aware of the issue, which is good. I really hope that theyâ€™ll figure out whatâ€™s wrong and release a second version of the ComfoBuds Mini that doesnâ€™t have these problems.I should probably take off more than one star for the quality control issueâ€¦but I just canâ€™t bring myself to. Because when these buds are working, theyâ€™re really the perfect sleep buds, and I just canâ€™t see myself ditching them; nothing blocks out my wifeâ€™s snoring more comfortably than these. I only hope that theyâ€™ll continue to improve in the future. In the meantime, itâ€™s up to you to decide if the risks outweigh the benefits.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2023
product_name: 1MORE ComfoBuds Mini Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Basically perfect, fantastic wind ANC, perfect case
author: Colin M.
content: I needed a replacement for my Galaxy buds pro's that have the fatal ANC "roar in one ear" that Samsung won't fix, and they don't stay in the ear. Bring an absolutely ENORMOUS fan of the 1more comfobuds z (the single best sleep focused earbuds at any price) I liked that these are also small, the case shape is wonderful (flip top, tiny, wireless charger) and they're relatively inexpensive.The sound quality uses 1more's app to do a "sounds" hearing preference test. I would prefer a proper EQ option but it works well enough. I prefer real audiophile iem's and headphones, but enjoyed the Galaxy buds on bass boost, they almost hit like planar magnetics. These are about 80% there. They're totally serviceable, with the only standout being a pretty good technical performance, with genuinely solid imaging and separation. They absolutely do need the soundID set up though, I hate the stock tuning. For tiny little things they are, I am perfectly happy with the sound quality when I want music on my bike or public transit.The ANC is stellar. They have a specific mode for wind reduction that downright curbstomps Samsung and apple. If you ride a bike, you need 1more ANC buds. The transparency mode is great too, very natural sounding. It doesn't have that "talk and it switches to transparency" gimmick, but I found it obnoxious on Samsung.Touch controls are easily customized and no "single touch" feature means you don't accidentally press anything readjusting or putting them in. Auto pauses when you take one out, your can use just one or the other no problemThe app features depend on the product but these are meant to be usable for sleeping, do they come preloaded with a library of sleep/ambient sounds. I just use my own but it's a nice feature. I can easily fall asleep with them in and I'm a very picky side sleeper, but I do prefer the absolutely microscopic comfobuds z's.The stock eartips did bother me a bit, they have a little ridge from the mold that irritated my ears after a few hours of use. They have a very odd mounting system that I was only able to find one option for, spinfit 1025 tips are shallow enough to fit and still let the case close (the wells for the eartips is a bit to shallow, id like it if they addressed this on a revision) so if you don't like the tips, spinfit 1025's.The case magnets that hold the buds in are hilariously strong. Your have to SMACK it to dislodge them. Very nice detail. The case size is tiny and perfectly shaped to slide into pockets, with a flip top that you can open one handedFor being so small they also stay put well. Not perfect, but I can work out or mow the lawn, an impossible task of the Galaxy buds pro.Overall though, these things rock. They're exactly what I need as a paramedic who also rides a bicycle. 1more is a serious brand with some seriously well thought out products at extremely competitive prices. I can sleep on my side with a podcast and still be able to wake up for a call, they crush wind nose when I'm riding my bike, they sound perfectly adequately tuned with impressive imaging (once you run the sound id feature once) and the case is (slightly too shallow recessions for the eartips aside) very nice in the hand and perfectly shaped.Highly recommend.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Decent but Defective
author: Aquila
content: UPDATE 6/24/22: As of 6/23/22, my replacement earbuds have the same problem. Sound is reduced then completely lost in the right earbud just a couple of weeks after normal use. Down to 1 star instead of 3 stars. Returning them. Stay within high quality brands like Sony, Bose, and Sennheiser. Replacing them with Sony WFC 500â€™s.UPDATE 6/5/22: Amazon replaced my earbuds after some arm twisting. My updated review is underneath the original:After my cheap but mighty pair of Sony wired earphones finally died after years of use, I decided to do some research and finally try earbuds after years of scoffing at the wireless craze. I decided on these due to having small ears. My first pair of comfobuds mini were defective. The right earbud made a ringing noise as soon as I began to use them out of the box. 2 weeks after purchase, the right earbud had no sound. Max sound volume doesnâ€™t sound very loud unless you have ANC mode turned on. It does not have a proper equalizer. With my defective pair, ANC mode drowned out the melodies even though the bass was good, so the sound wasnâ€™t very balanced. The touch controls hardly work nor are they very customizable. You sacrifice some features that should be included in this price point for the small size.Review for replacement earbuds:The packaging was different. These came in a black box with a manufacture date of 4/2022. My defective pair was in a white box with a 2/2022 manufacture date. Both pairs of the earbuds were black. The touch controls are more responsive and they work 70% of the time instead of the 20% success rate of my defective pair, but the controls are still very limited for the price point. These definitely are as loud as they should be at max volume. Bass is good and the sound is more balanced. The bass in the defective pair was definitely stronger, but it overpowered and drowned out the melodies, making the sound unbalanced and less dynamic. Iâ€™m not sure if this has to do with the pair itself or the firmware. I have been on firmware version 0.10.38 for both pairs and have not yet updated, so it may be the pair itself. Eartips are comfortable but they may be problematic as they donâ€™t create enough of a buffer between your ear and the mesh, so your mesh may get waxy which may impact the sound. Keep them and your ears clean and I recommend buying better aftermarket eartips. Since this is my first pair of wireless earbuds ever, I really canâ€™t accurately measure how good the ANC is as I have nothing to compare it to yet. I ride trains frequently and I never hear my surroundings when ANC is turned on. The battery life seems low at a 4 hour play time with ANC enabled, but the charging case replenishes life fairly quickly. 1more customer service was fine and replied to me quickly, but I ended up getting the replacement faster through Amazon customer service. Overall Iâ€™ll bump the earbuds up to a 3 out of 5 stars. They lose points for the lack of touch controls, lack of a real equalizer, and being overpriced. The sound is decent, the size is great, and they are light-weight and comfortable. While I still prefer the sound quality of wired earphones, Iâ€™ll keep these in my collection if they donâ€™t fizzle out on me too fast again.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good, comfortable headphones
author: Victoria
content: I'm very impressed with these little earbuds. I bought them because I have noisy upstairs neighbors and needed some noise cancelling headphones to help me sleep. I'm a side sleeper, and while these aren't totally perfect for that, they're comfortable enough that I don't have trouble falling asleep. It helps if you use a very squishy pillow (my memory foam pillow is too firm and makes them dig into my ears). They're very comfortable for regular daily use too. I have an oddly shaped ear canal that makes earbuds constantly fall out of my left ear, but these are small enough that they fit snugly.I'm no audiophile, but the sound is good. Can't complain. They don't sound as good as my Bose headphones that I normally wear, but they're like 1/50 of the size so I can't really fault them for that. I wish the app let you adjust the sound settings manually. As far as I can tell, you can only adjust them by taking their sound preference quiz. The touch controls are a little annoying. The tutorial said you double tap to play/pause, but I've never gotten that to work. They do sometimes randomly pause when I remove or adjust them, though.The noise cancelling works really well. I was kind of blown away by it, since I've never had earbuds with ANC capabilities before. I can't hear the thumping from my neighbors' music at ALL. Way better than I was expecting. It also blocks out the sound of my fan completely. I can definitely still hear sudden, abrupt noises, but it's very muffled. The "transparent" setting is also nice, since I like to be able to hear my surroundings when I'm out walking.These aren't marketed as sleep headphones, and I suspect that is partly because of the battery life. They last around 4 hours with ANC enabled, so they won't last you a full night's sleep. Not a huge deal for me since my neighbors usually cool it with the music at around 4am, but it wouldn't be ideal if you were trying to block out a snoring partner, loud AC unit, etc. For the price I didn't really expect much more than that, but it's significantly less than all of the other wireless earbuds I've owned. They do charge quickly, at least.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Finally
author: TJ Lewis
content: First this is coming someone who's worked in the tech industry for almost 30 years. I own my own IT/technology company and I am truly passionate about technology. Simply put these are the best fitting perfect size earbuds on the market. There are no competitors who make earbuds that aren't giant or hang out of medium to small ears. By combining all metrics that earbuds are judged by today the Comfo Buds minis are in a league of their own. The sound quality iis good, noise canceling decent and has the basic features (transparency, basic touch controls) that we have come expect. With that said it's impossible to provide a negative review of these earbuds without attempting to nitpick, are doing a deep comparison in the technical specifics that ultimately most users don't understand. There are very few things in the technology space that are the best at every facet of their market. If you are someone who has smaller ears or just thinks the average size of earbuds is ridiculous than these earbuds are perfect. No they're not top sound quality top noise canceling, top battery life. They are good everywhere. Let's hope 1More is the company that finally drives true innovation in the earbuds market regarding fit and size. Based on price feature set, fit and sound quality the Comfo buds mini have made all my other buds obsolete. My Samsung buds pro, My sound core Liberty pro 3s no longer have a place in my day. I just ordered the Galaxy s23 ultra and in the deal was included a set of Samsung Galaxy buds pro 2. I will update this review once I get my hands on them.My guess is they will be much larger and not have such overwhelming sound quality, ANC and battery life to overtake the 1More Comfo Buds minis. I finally having a full featured small set of earbuds that Make them very convenient for day-to-day use. Let's not forget you can get two or three pairs of these for the price of the "high end" brands. If you are a person with common sense you will love these buds. Let's be honest the majority of negative reviews come from people who see themselves as experts , love to talk detailed acronyms and technical statistics or those who don't quite understand how to use the product. FACT earbud size and fit is the number one failure across the earbud market. IMO 1More realized this simple obvious fact and provided a great product at a great price. As stated before let's hope all earbud manufacturers follow their lead. It's 2023! Manufacturing processes and the technology is there for all manufacturers to create a small size product with all features.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2024
product_name: 1MORE ComfoBuds Mini Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Earbuds

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Common issues people experiene are easily fixed and avoidable
author: Evan Reeves-Fortney
content: These are really great earbuds, especially for their size.There are common issues that people run into, which have them replacing the buds using the warranty over and over again before giving up and saying the earbuds seem to suffer from poor quality control or cheap components which fail after a few weeks or months.These issues are a high pitch squeaking noise, and very low volume or no sound. These issues can occur in one side only, or both sides.All you have to do is clean the metal mesh, it's become clogged with your earwax. Trust me, I guarantee that is what the problem is. You have to unclog all the little holes, I used a bristle from a brush which was thin enough to fit. The holes are very tiny.You might start to have volume issues with an earbud not being as loud as the other. It's the holes getting clogged. Once they're all clogged up, you won't be able to hear anything except a very quiet, constant, white noise.The screeching noise occurs when trying to use active noise canceling, while the metal screen is clogged. Don't ask me why, I'm not an expert, but for some reason that's what happens when the mesh is plugged up and you switch to ANC mode. The problem will be completely fixed once you clear out all those tiny holes.Tons of people report these issues occurring after about a month of use, and exchanging them only to run into similar issues with the new pair. It's not the earbuds, it's you. You've got gunk in your ears. You can prevent running into these problems by making sure your ears are clean before using them, cleaning off any earwax after you take them out and before putting them back in the case, and making sure the part of the case where the buds go is clean as well. If you do those three things, you won't end up with clogged up earbuds.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars I wanted to love these so much!
author: Domcalli
content: I love the buds and the thought put into the app, but the instability and lack of customization of the app and missing key features/functionality is what killed it for me. I had to return the earbuds. I hope they improve enough in the future that I can invest in them again without these issues.Bluetooth 5.2: Great connection and distance, but in order to connect to different devices you have to go into the device your connected to and disconnect before the other device can connect. My older Bluetooth headphones can release the connection when the new device wants to connect without having to go into the settings like that. (Why no multipoint if they have 5.2?)Also, one bud would randomly disconnect and reconnect occasionally.Call quality is definitely not great, while people said the could hear me fine, the also would say "what?" pretty frequently and on my end they sounded so shrill and tinny it was super unpleasant.Noise cancellation was actually really good to me, and the transparency mode was so good it almost felt like I didn't have anything in my ears at all.For dinner reason you can't use transparency mode when only one bud is in. It has to be both buds or not at all.The app crashed frequently. I wish they would allow for more touch control customization. I understand why they chose not to have single tap on these buds but the option would have been nice.Sound quality was awesome for my music, but it didn't carry over to videos and podcasts very well, so having multiple sound profiles would have been nice.The tips suck, not comfortable at all. I bought some spinfits that made a world of difference but it couldn't make up for all the other faults. I really wanted these to work because the sound quality and small size are so good, but I couldn't get past the other faults enough to keep them.I hope they make these improvements in the future. It is mostly software and firmware fixes, I would definitely get these again if they were more stable and customizable.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic product, one minor gripe
author: StLouisAudioPhile
content: I love how small these things are. They fit snugly in my ears and sound absolutely fantastic. The noise cancellation function is nice but not perfect; it's enough for most use cases but if you want complete and total silence, I might look elsewhere.The app is easy to use and convenient, the tap response is very smooth and useful, and the connection is very strong. I'm getting about 5 hours of use per charge, which is nothing to scoff at. The charging case is fairly small. I'm getting a Qi charging pad today so I'll update this review to let you all know whether it's compatible or not.My only complaint is a minor one: the silicon tips that come with these are trash. The driver and tip came apart almost immediately, and for the life of me I can't get them to fit comfortably or stay together. I got some new foam tips which are far better, but the case needs the earbuds to fit very snugly so they won't charge with other tips on. This isn't a deal breaker for me because the pros far outweigh the cons, but it's important enough to document here.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect!
author: james crippen
content: Very comfortable could wear all day and great battery life for the size. It has impressive sound from such a small package, can get loud enough to drown out background noise with anc on.The two things that prevent this from being perfect are:One, there is no touch controls that I have found to allow you to control the volume. This is a big deal as I use ear buds to listen to tv at night and I'm unable to use these as the volume is always maxed out with no way to lower..Two, you have to use the case to pair to different devices. This makes it difficult to swap connections, I typically switch between a computer, phone, and tv throughout my normal day. With other earbuds I'm able to put them into pairing mode and easily connect to whatever device I'm using without taking them out or using the case.If they could fix these two issues, these would be the only buds I would use, but I do have to switch to one ov my other sets for tv watching do to the volume control.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Volume Kept Diminishing and then Melted in Charger
author: Ian
content: I bought these in January of 2024. Initially worked great and stayed in my ears even while asleep. But within 2 months the maximum volume on one of the buds started to diminish. Then it got quieter in the other earbud. Eventually I had only one earbud that worked and it would barely emit any sound. I reached out to their customer service and they were able to send me a new one, but only after I jumped through a bunch of hoops and paid $12 to send them the broken one with trackable shipping with UPS since they needed a tracking #.The second set worked well about a month until the same thing happened with one of the earbuds getting quieter. Then one morning before work I plugged them in for about 15 minutes. I can't imagine what would have happened if I left them any longer, because when I grabbed the case, it was so hot that I burned my fingers (even left a mark for a few days). It had melted the plastic around the charge port and even destroyed my charging cord.I would not recommend this product as it is a piece of trash that runs the risk of burning your house down.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars You can do better
author: Michael Kalman
content: These earbuds were a disappointment and I returned them after a few days. Previous 1More earbuds I have purchased in the past were superbly packaged with great documentation. That was not the case 1More Comfobuds. The sound produced by the earbuds is good, not great. True to their name, they are very lightweight, a plus. But the documentation for this product is unacceptable in terms of the limited amount of information and the absurdly small type in the users manual. The documentation states that the earbuds come with replacement buds of a larger and smaller size, but there were none in my package. Nor is there an app associated with this device which allows you to adjust controls. So between the unreadable manual and the absence of an app, I had absolutely no idea how to adjust. For example, I had no idea how to activate or regulate the noise cancellation feature. I replaced these earbuds with 2nd Gen iPod Pros, at twice the price, but more than twice the value in comparison to the 1More Comfobuds. I am happy with my decision.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Mini, but Mighty
author: Deth
content: Look, we know you aren't here for premium sound quality if you're looking at the tiniest earbuds and in this price range. That being said, these do still sound quite nice! There's a lot of oomph for such a small package. Unless you're used to professional grade sound equipment, these will cover most anyone's sound needs.SMALL EAR HAVERS! I have been on a quest to find comfy earbuds. So far, these have come the closest. I can wear them for like 2 hours with minimal discomfort. This is a huge upgrade from "most cause physical pain near immediately". When placed correctly, they're pretty solid. I couldn't shake them out. They did come loose a handful of times and needed to be readjusted, but in comparison to the others needing that every 5 minutes? I'll take it.They say they have ANC, but honestly, I'm not so sure. In my personal experience, turning ANC on didn't actually cancel any noise. It just brought the bass out. Unless I just can't get the right fit, the ANC mode is effectively just a "make the music sound better" button.The drawback here is that you can only use ANC if both buds are in. Not usually a problem, unless you want to pop one in to listen to music and leave the other ear open for communication. The make the music sound better button won't do anything with just one bud.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Completely unreliable
author: Skirkwo2
content: I would recommend looking elsewhere for earbuds unless it absolutely has to be these. From a technical perspective battery life, sound quality, and reliability were my major issues. I knew the batteries lasted less than 8 hours with anc on but personally think 8 hours needs to be the target to get you through long haul flights. Then comes the audio quality which is good but not great they do have an app to adjust the equalizer, though not directly, and it did make it sound better to my ears but still fell a bit flat. The final issue that I have gone through 2 pair in less than a month. It starts off as a low hum/click in the left ear bud when anc or passthrough are active that gets worse over time. It is low and might be missed by many but if you go through the reviews you will find others reporting the same issue. It appears many people either donâ€™t have this problem or it doesnâ€™t bother them so you might get lucky but at the MSRP it wouldnâ€™t be worth the risk for me.On the positive side these buds are the smallest I have ever tried and I love them for that.m. Other than the slight ear pressure I have forgotten they are in. I also have found the ANC is reasonable but donâ€™t perform anywhere close the Sony xm2 headphones. I would say they fall in the middle of the pack of noise canceling headphones nothing to special but nothing to complain about.Overall, because of the prevalent quality issue that exists in late 2022/early 2023 and my personal experiences, I give this a solid one star but would be back to try a version 2 because they have a unique product and quite a bit of potential.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars not just good for the price but good
author: Champ
content: For those of you that know the history of htc know that they were titans of personal electronics & cell phones. Today most people don't know their name but they were The company that helped make android what it is today back when windows mobile was installed on 99% of portable devices.The buds are not the best on the market not even close. But these tiny little buds compete with them. Yup at $20 these buds have minimal latency & a rich harmony of sound. They are also pretty comfortable. They take a few seconds longer than preferred to pair each time I take them out of their case but that could also be my device so I don't consider that as a device issue. I've had some that have paired by the time I have the buds in my ear, these are still beeping for a couple seconds. Probably a total of 4-5 seconds total to connect. Not a huge deal but not preferred. They almost never disconnect & give me lossless sound at 15 distance from my device. So when I'm in the house listening to music these are still good. Touch controls are very sensitive so there's no need to press over an over they are very responsive. I bought these prima for music but wanted the voice controls as well. The noise cancelling could use some improvement. Most calls are great, but when in high wind they do not cancel the noise. Over all calls are just fine on these buds but could be a little bit better. I bought these for music anyway. Very small case so they are easy to lose but that's the standard for buds these days so I cannot count that against them either. In the end they sound pretty good across a variety of music genres rock, jazz, pop, classic, rap, blues, & R&B. They are not automatically variable across all audio formats so disparity is present between codecs & quality but most buds are this way even many more expensive ones. Most people just stream music anyway & won't notice the difference because this only matters if you own alot of your own music. In the end these are really good buds worth more than they are sold for. These aren't cheap buds these are solid quality buds. Htc hasn't sacrificed quality. These buds can easily be sold for $80 instead they are sold for $20 well worth it in my opinion
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2022
product_name: HTC Wireless Headphones Bluetooth 5.1

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Amazing! But suddenly stopped working
author: Allison Babor
content: These were by far my absolute favorite wireless earbuds I had tried! Sound quality was wonderful, the battery lasted me well over 24 hours of use from one charge. Noise cancellation actually worked!The only downside is they just suddenly stopped working, started with the right earbud. I always make sure to thoroughly clean my earbuds, so they weren't dirty or anything. It just stopped working mid song one day. Then, about a month later, the left one went out. They've charged, I have cleaned them again in case something got stuck in them, nothing. I can't figure out what made them die on me.Definitely going to order again, though! May have just been a fluke with my pair.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not as good as the previous model, but decent
author: public name
content: This is my third time buying these earbuds and I hate them now. They keep lowering the quality of them. This generation of this product isnt worth having. The touch/tap controls simply don't work. It doesn't matter what the instructions say - it's only on/off.In addition, they're sensitive. Brushing against your ear (not tapping on the earbud) will stop your media or hang up your calls and in some frequent and infuriating cases - disconnects your earbuds from Bluetooth altogether. But tapping on them will not reconnect anything. :))))))I hate these I'm not buying them ever again.~~~~~(This product on the left. previous product, now removed,on the right.)My review for the previous model was a glowing review. The sound quality was great, the range was great, and an earbud *went through the washing machine* and still worked. 5* and chefs kiss. It was $30 ~ $40 if I remember correctly.This product is almost as perfect. Two complaints though and to be clear I'm comparing this product to it's predecessor. The sound is not as great as the last model but this *is* about $10 cheaper. When in pairing mode - the earbuds make a loud beeping sound, nonstop, until paired. The downside is that you can't put your earbuds in and then pair Bluetooth because the noise hurts. The beeping is not loud enough to find a missing earbud.All in all,Cheers to HTC for making a product affordable and yet still better quality than the competition.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2022
product_name: HTC Wireless Headphones Bluetooth 5.1

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars It was so close to perfection!
author: Misein
content: I have a peculiar penchant when it comes to earbuds. I like them to be compact to fit under my helmet, have loud enough clarity that I can hear them over my bike's engine, be touch sentitive and not a button, and most importantly, be able to skip song tracks with a long button press as opposed to a double click. These fit every single box. They even make a light to let you know when you've changed tracks. This is important to me so I can tell when I successfully did skip to the next song and not accidentally pause my music instead. They were so close to perfection. Except for one major problem that ruins it for me. Any small drop, matter how light, will break it. I once dropped a bud while sitting down onto thick carpet and the sound went out in it. All other functions worked except it made no noise. I figured I got a defective product and Amazon was happy to replace it. I loved my second one until I dropped it on my bed and the earbud died again. If the maker made them any more durable, I would happily buy a third pair. They have good sound quality, are compact, great battery life, and have all the functions I want. However, any drop over 15 inches, no matter the surface will break their sound. Every other function in that dropped earbud will work but it will be completely muted. I truly wish I could give this product the 5 stars it deserves but after going through two of the same earbuds with the same issue, I simply can't do so. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 solely because of the audio and ticking off all my boxes. Unfortunately, because of it's fragility, I can't give it any better. I wish I could but a 15.3 inch fall into my mattress should not be enough to kill it.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2022
product_name: HTC Wireless Headphones Bluetooth 5.1

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great little earbuds, very reliable
author: Zak Clay
content: I have tried 3 different kinds of wireless buds at this price point, and these are the only ones that have lasted close to 6 months (and still going strong).. I have had no issues with pairing and keeping them paired, the sound quality isnt groundbreaking, but it's quite decent, certainly excellent for the price. They are comfortable in the ear, so much that you almost forget it's in there if you're distracted haha.. they do slip a little bit if you have a lot of sweat on them. You can pause/unpauses the music by just tapping on the earbud, which is handy.And to some extent, yeah, these are kinda waterproof. I wouldn't leave them submerged long, but I did drop one in the bathtub once and it was fully submerged for several seconds.. I got it out and it was still playing. Haven't noticed any issue with it all at.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Just an all around pain to use
author: Ryan L.
content: Upon my first use I was mildy impressed. They're not expensive, and I was hoping for the typical good HTC experience I had gotten after owning several of their phones. These things kind of suck if you're trying to live life while using them. First, they put all the weight on the top of the bud, which means that any head movement loosens them in your ear. I tried all the sizes of cushion, and none of them keep them in my ear canal for more than a minute or two if I'm walking. I constantly have to push them back in. If my hands are full, for example - bringing groceries into the house, one or both will fall out. Riding my bike yesterday, I had one fall out on the cement trail, bouncing into the weeds. I stopped quickly which caused the other to fall out. I spent 6 minutes looking for the damn thing before finding it. I tried switching left and right which allows them to sit sideways in my ears, and it's a little bit better, but not enough. Also, they cut out a lot. If my phone is in my pocket just above my knee and I'm walking the sound cuts out to the rhythm of my steps. Charming. Same with riding my bike. Have to put it in my shirt pocket. Have not had this problem with other Bluetooth headphones.In conclusion, if you're in a coma, playing dead, or part of a freeze flashmob, they're pretty good. If you are a normal person with stuff to do, you'll want to punt them into the great beyond.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Raycons better up their game if they wanna compete.
author: Dawson
content: Before I bought these I had raycons. Raycon earbuds are absolute trash. The feel was cheap and they broke after dropping them. The sound was eh but absolute trash. I had to use the warranty to get a new pair and same issue. I had to eventually buy a new pair and I decided I wouldn't ever buy raycons again and since these were on sale for $60 I decided to give them a shot. I knew JBL was a great speaker and headphones brand so I wanted to give them a try. Omg they are the best earbuds I've ever had. They're so easy to connect to ur phone and you can change the sound profile from the app. The sound cancellation is like nothing I've ever had even better somehow than my gaming headphones I think. The bass is unreal!!! The sound clarity and everything is incredible. Best earbuds I've ever had. They are durable too. They feel like good quality and the case is perfect. It feels good it snaps shut and has a good satisfying feel and sound when it does. It fits perfectly in my pocket and the charge life is so fricken long I can go a week without charging it and it still has life. I've had these for about a month and only charged them maybe twice. I'm so happy with the way these are id highly suggest buying these. Especially over raycon earbuds. I'm so happy I helped people not waste their money on that crappy brand. Someone I talked to even canceled their order to buy a pair of these and thanked me because these were on sale for way cheaper. But even at base price for only a few dollars more why not buy quality? If you want the best earbuds I'd say on the market ....buy these. It's cheap for the experience and quality your getting.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2024
product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing sound quality
author: Amazon Customer
content: This review is representative of my first impressions after receiving the item.Fit - 4/5: While I've had better fitting earbuds in the past, I would say that these aren't problematic at all, but not perfect either. The buds fit fairly snugly in my ears, and its quite nice that they've included a few tips. They don't seem to move around if I shake my head, so I have decent confidence that if I take them to the gym or on a run, I wouldn't have problems. That said, they don't quite fit perfectly, but everyones ear is a bit different so others might find it better or worse.Sound - 5/5: All I can say is wow do I love the sound that these produce. The level of bass is far beyond anything that I've had from my other earbuds (Jabra Elite 65t and Jlabs JBuds Air). The app includes equalizer settings that actually make quite a lot of difference (unlike other headphone apps I have used) and I am blown away by how much bass can come from these headphones. I have also noticed with other wireless buds that they tend to be on the quiet side, not reaching the same volume that my larger Sony headphones can, but that is not at all the case here. These get LOUD. As someone who plans to mainly use these for workouts, this is exactly what I hoped for.Battery - 5/5: So far I have not had a chance to use these until they die, so I have to disclaim that. However, if the battery matches up or comes close to their claims, which I expect they will given it is a reputable brand, then I will be impressed. My other buds max out at around 8 hours, so getting almost 4x the total battery life is excellent. 8 hours without recharging is very impressive.Look and feel - 3/5: The case looks nice and I think the aesthetics are fine. But the buds themselves are polished smooth, which makes them a bit tricky to handle with your fingertips. Once they're in, its no problem. But a matte finish or some texture would have been better for usability.I'll update this review if I find any reason to, but I am extremely impressed by the headphones, especially for the price point. Highly recommend!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2024
product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars At 50% or more off, these are great.
author: Dru Ha
content: I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldnâ€™t have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair theyâ€™re a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds. Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3â€™s. Iâ€™m an audiophile on a budget. They canâ€™t compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds theyâ€™re a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. Iâ€™ve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think thatâ€™s due to the EQ setting Iâ€™ve selected. You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I havenâ€™t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the â€œambient-awareâ€ or â€œtalk throughâ€ modes. Thatâ€™s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which donâ€™t seem to have any functional ANC. I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. Theyâ€™ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1. However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc. itâ€™s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I donâ€™t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2024
product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, these are good sounding earbuds
author: Mike
content: There are review sites around that test headphones and earbuds and as far accuracy in frequency response and imaging, these earbuds outrank most other brand's more expensive earbuds.I have the JBL Tune 600BTNC headphones which are a great over the ear headphones and these earbuds sound just as good and even a bit clearer. That's hard to do. Both, these 230NC and the 600BTNC have bass between 20Hz and 100Hz elevated by 3db to 5db, the 230NC being a bit more accurate. That's Ok because I like my bass a few decibels higher.These earbuds have really good punch as well as ultra low bass down to 20HZ. Comparing these 230NC to your subwoofer is a great way to see how good or weak your subwoofer is. Since these 230NC earbuds are accurate from 20Hz to 60Hz within 1db or +4db above 100Hz, most subwoofers can't provide the bass these earbuds can.The clarity in the midrange and treble is great, and without elevation to make music sound bright and fatiguing.I have tried the JBL Club Pro Plus and Tune 125TWS and neither would seal correctly or be comfortable to wear more than 10 minutes. Mainly because of the big club at the end of the actual ear piece. Those earbuds don't fit good in every ear because they are big. The 230NC doesn't have club at the end of the earpiece but a small thin stalk like most "wired" earbuds that fit everyone good. These 230NC with their long thin stalks fit my ears good and seal good, plus they are actually more comfortable than my 600BTNC headphones. The Club Pro Plus actually hurt my ears and left them in pain for an hour after only wearing them for 10 minutes.These 230NC earbuds sound great, seal good, and are comfortable enough to wear for hours. I don't see doing any better than some $300 earbuds or headphone for sound quality.The one thing they fall down in and so do my 600BTNC is that they use the lower class active noise cancelling instead of the adaptive noise canceling. Honestly they sound great even in a noisy plant with the active noise cancelling.For the price slashing Amazon does to the retail price, they are a bargain IMO.The only thing I wish they had was function to test if they are sealed correctly like the Club Pro Plus had in it's app. That way you know you are getting the maximum bass response that these earbuds can produce. I simply test using music with ultra low bass that I'm very familiar with.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2023
product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars A satisfactory pair of earbuds with a decent attempt at noise cancellation
author: Tonigiri
content: In this review, I will compare the jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds with some of the best wireless earbuds of 2023, based on four criteria: noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, and design.Noise cancellation: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have active noise cancellation, which works well in most situations, but may not be effective in very loud environments. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with outstanding noise-canceling performance that adapts to your surroundings and personal preferences. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also excellent, with adjustable noise cancellation levels and a transparency mode. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is another good option, with effective noise cancellation and spatial audio support.Sound quality: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds deliver a decent sound quality, with a balanced and clear output. However, they may not satisfy audiophiles who prefer a more detailed and dynamic sound. The Technics EAH-AZ80 wireless earbuds are the best in this category in my opinion, with a superb sound quality that rivals some of the best over-ear headphones. They have a rich and balanced sound signature, with deep bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. They also support high-resolution audio codecs and have a dedicated app for EQ customization. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are also great, with a dynamic and engaging sound that can be tweaked via the Sony Headphones Connect app. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also impressive, with a top-notch sound quality that is well-balanced and natural. Keep in mind that the jbl 230 nc sits in a very different price point than the earbuds above so it's still punching way above its weight in this regard.Battery life: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a battery life of about four hours, which is average for wireless earbuds. They come with a charging case that can provide an additional 12 hours of playback. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with a battery life of up to eight hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 24 hours with the charging case. They also have a quick charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just 10 minutes of charging. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 are also good, with a battery life of up to six hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 30 hours with the charging case. They also support wireless charging and have a fast charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just five minutes of charging.Design: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a simple and sleek design, with a matte black finish and a jbl logo on each earbud. They are lightweight and comfortable to wear, with three sizes of silicone ear tips to choose from. They are also water-resistant, which means they can withstand sweat and rain. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is the best in this category, with a sleek and ergonomic design that fits snugly in your ears. They have an open design without tips, which means they don't block out the outside sound completely. They also have force sensors on each stem that let you control music playback, calls, noise cancellation, and voice assistants. The Beats Fit Pro wireless earbuds are also stylish and comfortable, with a winged design that keeps them secure in your ears. They have an IPX4 rating for water resistance and have touch controls on each earbud.Conclusion: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds are a decent pair of headphones for casual listeners who want to escape the noise of the world. However, they are not the best in any category, and they face stiff competition from other models that offer better performance and features. If you want the best noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, or design, you may want to consider other options such as the Sony WF-1000XM5, the Technics EAH-AZ80, the Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2, or the Apple AirPods Pro 2. At this price point however, which is often lower (I bought mine on sale for 50% off), the jbl 230 nc is a no-brainer and will give you a value you can't say no to.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Had high hopes, jury is still out.
author: Shonna
content: I bought these to replace my skullcandy sesh Evo. I had the skillcandy for over a year & recently I lost the left bud & then the right ear bud decided it was gonna be finicky about charging. Like the sensor wasn't connecting properly anymore. It was getting super frustrating because I only had 1 ear bud left & when I wanted to use it it would either be dead or only give me a few minutes. After watching many reviews on YouTube & reading them here I decided I'd get these JBL ones as they had good reviews & *bonus* they were on sale for $49.00. I am on day 3 of using them. Around my house I normally only wear 1 ear bud so I can still keep an ear on my kids. I used the right ear bud all day yesterday, sticking it back in the case when not in use. Last night I went to use the left ear bud & it didn't automatically connect when I took it out like the right one. When I had both out it connected so I put the right back in the case. When I woke up this morning I went to use the left one & the app said it only had 20% battery even though it was in the charger all night. In messing with them I realized even in the case the left was still connected & playing. I finally got it to connect to the charger & work properly. But I feel like it shouldn't be this difficult. It's not rocket science placing the ear buds in the case. I am using these for music, podcasts, & watching shows. The sound is great. I haven't made calls with them. They fit comfortably in my ear, I like the black sleek color. I am just hoping I don't continue to have charging or connection issues as I will use these EVERY SINGLE DAY all throughout the day.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best battery life, Great noise cancelling, awkward fit in case
author: N8
content: I have only used wired headphones for years. This is the first time I've ever purchased Bluetooth wireless ear buds - so, know going forwards that I don't have anything to compare these to.That being said, I do have a few pairs of Bluetooth wireless headphones, and I'm making some assumptions, based upon these.So, the first thing I'll say is that the Noise Canceling feature in these is downright amazing. I mean, for something so small to be able to block out so much noise is just quite unbelievable.In addition, the Ambient Aware mode is quite amazing as well, as you can literally hear everything around you, while still hearing the music quite clearly - you can tell that a lot of R & D went into these.The Talk Through mode is also good - although I think it makes the music so low that you really can't even hear it - but it is handy in case you need to have a conversation. I've had a conversation with Ambient Aware mode turned on, and I can hear the other person just fine.Okay, here is where I'll start making some assumptions. I don't have another pair of BT earbuds to compare to, so I'm assuming that other companies would create apps similar to the ones for their BT headphones when making apps for their ear buds.The JBL app is my favorite one. It's very easy to get into, has some settings you can change (like what each ear bud does when you touch it certain ways), as well as allows you to change the audio mode that you've enabled.Now, I have a pair of Anker BT headphones, and they are really comfy, but the app is nowhere near as feature-rich as the JBL app is.I guess if there is anything that I don't like about these it would be the inability to turn them off without using the app. You can set them to time out after a set amount of time, so they would turn themselves off at some point, but I think that is a waste of the battery, so I use the app to turn them off.Another thing I don't like is the case - the ear buds fit into it in a very awkward way - I'm always having to twist my wrists to get them in correctly. I think this was a major design flaw, but it's minor compared to all the other benefits of these.One thing I absolutely love on these is the battery. I've used these for about an hour, turned them off (via the app), kept them outside of the case, and come back to them a month later, and they are still at the same battery percentage as a month ago - unbelievable.I should also mention that the battery lasts a fair amount of time when actually listening to them. I use these when working out, and they last plenty of time for me to run and lift weights.I've never actually tried to figure out exactly how long they last on one charge, but if I'd have to guess, it's probably upwards of 5 hrs at least.To save battery power, I usually put mine in a ziplock bag, along with the case - so that the battery gets to run-down without being recharged all the time. I only put them back into the case when the battery is actually low.The case also charges very quickly (as do the ear buds as well).So, overall, I'd highly recommend these ear buds. They have some minor issues that I've discussed, but in my opinion, the pro's far outweigh the con's for these.If you found this review helpful, please click on "helpful" or the thumb's up.Thanks.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not good for motorcycle use, but excellent sound quality.
author: Jeffrey Jenkins
content: I bought these in an attempt to improve upon the mediocre sound quality of the "MiPeace" earbuds I've been using on my motorcycle for about a year now, and in that respect the JBL did not disappoint - these really are quite good sounding (almost as good as my old Etymotic ER-6 wired earbuds). Sitting on my bike with the engine running but not moving the active noise cancellation seemed to work very well - I couldn't hear the engine at all, actually - but once I started moving things weren't quite so rosy. It seems the active noise cancellation is just a tad too slow to respond to wind buffeting noise because the music is horribly distorted as if one is listening to speakers through the spinning blades of a fan. Unfortunately, with the active noise cancellation turned off the silicone cup style earplugs don't do near as good a job of passively blocking ambient sounds as the silicone triple-rib style earplugs on the MiPeace (or the Elgin's I replaced these with), so I reluctantly returned them.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing
author: Ken
content: There are several things I like about the JBL 230. The sound quality is pretty good and the noise cancelling is excellent for this price range. So, if you're in a noisy office or work environment, these may work for you. The battery life is great, and the JBL app provides a good equalizer for customizing your sound. I love the blue color, and the touch controls work, even if finding that "sweet" spot takes a bit of practice.What I don't like is that every time you put the earbuds in, they start in the "Ambient Aware" mode (sounds around you are amplified). It's great, if you want to hear what Margret down in accounting thinks about Bob's new haircut from across the room, but I hate it. I'm typically putting in earbuds to block out the sound around me, not to make it louder. Plus, the Ambient Aware function uses battery life. I'd much rather have the ability to start in a "normal" (non-amplified) setting, but that's not available. You have to start with them active and either open up the app to turn it off or set the buds to use a touch feature to turn it off (meaning you can't use the touch feature to control your music, change volume or anything else).My second gripe is around the microphones and wind. Any slight breeze makes it impossible for you to be heard at the other end of a phone call. I'm often outside and I simply can't make phone calls if there's a breeze. Likewise, driving with the windows down while on the phone is a no-go. The wind drowns out everything else. If you happen to have Ambient Aware turned on (remember, it's the default?), it amplifies that wind noise in your ears, as well, even if you're not on the phone. This is a real deal breaker, and everyone from Apple to Samsung and Sony do a much better job of limiting wind noise on phone calls with their buds.There are other minor things. The buds are very lightweight, which is good, but they stick a little too far out of my ear, so they're always getting knocked loose. They sit in the case with the speakers facing outward, so you always have to turn them around when taking them out or putting them away, since most people are designed with their ear canals going *in* to their heads (this design makes zero sense). The app is slow to load. You can't do anything in the app until it finds and connects to your buds, so you have to have at least one bud in to use the app for anything, which is weird (I can't even view the app right now to tell you about it because my buds are at home, so the app won't open), and many app features aren't accessible unless you have both buds in.I really wanted to like these, but the inability to use them in 90% of the cases I want them just makes them worthless to me.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice sound quality, terrible case
author: Izabella
content: Usually I wouldn't take off an entire star for something as seemingly mere as the case, but I am with these earbuds. This case is so slippery. I am someone very mindful of my electronics and have never so much as cracked a phone screen, but I can't even count how many times this case has just slipped out of my hands or off of a surface. The charging lights on the case have began to malfunction. I like these earbuds, but I would recommend storing the case in a pouch or something with a little more grip to it.As for the earbuds themselves, they're great. I've had them for a year now and they work wonderfully. The audio quality is great, not the best but worth the price. They fit into my ears wonderfully and don't slip out easily which is quite rare for me. The Bluetooth range also seems to be quite large and I never have issues with that.One other thing is that the battery has definitely dwindled rapidly in the past year, but I use these earbuds everyday for at least a few hours, so that's to be expected. I don't mind charging them more often. The earbuds themselves still last about five to seven hours on a full charge, which is absolutely perfect for me.I like these earbuds a lot. I've never disliked a JBL product, really. I just wish the case wasn't so slick.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ambient Aware white noise
author: Adam
content: Edit: Dropping original 5/5 for both earbuds to 3.5/5. Connectivity problems occasionally. I had the microphone just straight up gave up in the middle of a call and had to restart my computer to get it back to work again, unpair and pair didn't work. Occasionally, they randomly disconnect for a second or so, like every couple of hours on average. When that happens, there's a chance for one ear bud to be slightly delayed than the other, and has to unpair and pair to fix.If you use both earbuds all the time, then it's great for $50-60. 5/5Comfortably fit in my ears and don't fall out much when jogging. They'll still fall out when the moving is too much, but that's unavoidable in any earbuds like this. ANC works wonders. The sound quality is good for the price. Microphone is hit and miss like every other earbud out there, but generally works well.If you ever use just the right earbud, then it's awful. 0/5The ambient aware gives out a very audible white noise all the time. And it will automatically be turned on if you only use the right earbud. You cannot turn it off because the ambient aware setting is on the left earbud only. You can only turn that off in the phone app. But if the earbud is not connected to the phone, then you can't change it.One work around is to go to the phone app and let both earbud to have the ambient aware on off functions, but you will lose the right earbud's play/pause function. And you need to turn it off every single time you use it.The connection chime and setting change chimes are extremely loud and I can't find a way to lower the volume. So that's further annoyance. This applies to both single and both earbuds modes.I personally hate these and will be returning the earbuds. Such a shame.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased for watching TV without disturbing others.
author: brian
content: This is my first Bluetooth listening device, thou not my first JBL product purchase. That would be a pair of L26 speakers, I purchased on lay-a-way, when I was 16, back in 1976 for $875. That would be over $6000 in 2023 dollars. Later I purchased JBL's J2050 Book-Shelf speakers and later still JBL's Media 100 Desk-Top speakers. I guess you would say, I would recommend JBL products, since I've had a 48 year relationship with their brand.I was on the brink of returning the JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds but decided to contact JBL Customer support, to find out why I was unable to connect my ear-buds to my TV. I submitted a fairly detailed explanation, sufficient for their support staff to realize I was already paired to my phone. So I learned that ear-buds come in single-pairing and multi-point-pairing. The JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds are single-pairing, which is just fine for me. These ear-buds can be very immersive, watching TV or Listening to music. The noise cancellation does a nice job of muffling surrounding noise. I had taken them with me on walks to listen to music or books-recordings and I became a bit concerned at how much of the sound around me was deadened. You then have to keep your head on a swivel.As these are my first ear-buds, I don't know if this is common but while out for a walk, the microphone ports, built into the ear-buds, pick up and transmit the sound of the wind scouring the microphone ports.

content: I looked all over the internet for wireless earbuds that are actually affordable (less than $30) and work well overall, and I found these! after having them for about a year, i can confidently say these are perfect (for me and maybe you)(1) they have a small case meaning its easy to take anywhere(2) the whole case and buds have magnets meaning nothing with pop out if you drop it from a short distance (they will if its at a higher distance but ultimately these are reliable)(3) because they are wireless, small and black, im able to wear these in class under my hair without my teacher knowing(4) the charging cable is great as i can charge it anywhere without needing an extra cable(5) the price is great for the quality(6) these are super easy to use (with the taps and stuff found in the manual given)(7) the battery life is amazing (takes less than 2 hours to fully charge the case and it lasts me like 5 days)(8) its practical (i can use the buds separately to extend the battery life and they rarely fall from my ear)(9) it does have some noise cancellation and the sound doesn't escape (just make sure not to blast it)(10) you can easily connect it to multiple devicesalso cause im lowkey a clumsy person, ive dropped these like 30 times so i ended up killing the left bud, but the right one still worked (how?) title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good inexpensive earbuds.
author: nekoBasu
content: I recommend these as an inexpensive earbud set.I like that they're red, so that stand out on my messy desk.I needed a new set to of earbuds, and decided Apple wasn't getting any more of my money in this space. I'm not thrilled with the longevity or support apple provides for their airpods pro.I found these on a list of of good cheap earbuds, and I'm happy. They work fine at the gym. out of the box, with the default rubber ear tips, I ran a mile on the treadmill this morning and I didn't fiddle with these once (for fit). They stay right where they're supposed to, which is not something I can say for airpods pro or another pair of earbuds I'd been using at the gym.These are not audiophile grade headphones. if you want that, keep looking. They do isolate pretty well. The base on the bass boost eq setting is just ok. But the sound is balance enough that it's not overly "tinny". I hate cheap speakers, and these don't sound too cheap. So while it's not the finest sound ever, it's still far from junk.Technically, coming from airpods, there are two downsides I've noticed (both survivable).1 - with my fingers - the buds themselves are very hard to remove from the charging case. If I never had owned airpods, I'm not sure I would know this. on the other hand, I think they seat really nicely in the case, and thus they always charge. The airpods famously don't always connect inside their case and sometimes aren't charging when you think they are. I'm ok with it, and I assume I'll eventually learn the "trick" to pulling these guys out with ease.2 - these were very easy to pair to my iphone. HOWEVER, unlike airpods, once these are paired to a device, they CANNOT be paired to another device unless they bluetooth connection is disconnected from the first device. e.g. with airpods, you can go back and forth between a macbook, an iphone, and an ipad, simply by selecting the airpods from the device. With these, if I was using them with my iphone, and then I want to use them with my ipad, I need to turn bluetooth off on the iphone for a moment until the buds are "free", and then I can connect them to my ipad. Sub-optimal, but not a deal breaker for me./a few pluses.1 - I can side-sleep with these in and they don't hurt. yay.2 - I love that the usb charging plug is integrated into the case. last thing I need is more cables.3 - again, for me, they fit well. Snug, almost to the point of being too big, but they don't bother me. I'm really impressed that they just stay put while I'm running and I don't need to constantly push them back into my ears for fear that they'll fall out./I haven't really had these long enough to have an opinion on the battery life.I haven't tried using these for calls yet, so no opinion on the microphone.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024
product_name: JLab Go Air Pop True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: First Impressions
author: MayBae
content: UPDATE:My AirPods are dying and have been constantly dropping Bluetooth with my phone, so I borrowed these from my daughter to wear for the day. I have had the right bud in for 7.5 hours and the battery percentage (which actually does show up on my phone screen in the control center) shows that I still have 40% battery life left. I also have not dropped Bluetooth once (!) and they still feel comfortable and light in my ear. Iâ€™m pretty astounded, actually. My AirPods would have died hours ago. The only issue I had was when I received a phone call. My phone rang, as well as hearing the ringing through the earbud, but when I answered, it did not automatically connect to the earbud at all. I had to talk into the phone normally. I also have noticed a distinct difference in the bass level between these and the AirPods. I donâ€™t know how much of it has been the slow death of the AirPods, but these sound so much better than the first time I tried them. 10/10. Do it.Old Review:I heard these were a pretty decent earbud set for the price and decided to try them out as a backup set. Iâ€™m coming from AirPod Pro (1st Generation) and prior to that, the Jabra 75t.I have to admit, this isnâ€™t bad for a $25 set of earbuds. One of the reasons I switched from the Jabra 75tâ€™s (aside from the fact I had to get warranty replacements TWICE), was because I wanted to be able to use each earbud interchangeably and Jabra did not have that at the time. Iâ€™m actually quite surprised that JLab included the functionality for this price point. The charger being built into the bottom of the case was a nice touch and I appreciate that both earbuds go in the case magnetically, as well as the lid being magnetic as well. It paired easily with my iPhone 15 Pro and my daughterâ€™s iPad.These are definitely lighter than both my Jabras and Pros. They fit in the ear nicely and I could see myself being able to wear them for a while (doing most things) and not have them fall out. My ears must be different sizes because my Pros consistently fall out of my left ear, but stay pretty good in my right ear.There isnâ€™t an app for these, so while you can change songs, adjust volume, and use Siri by pressing the buttons on the earbuds, you wonâ€™t be able to tweak any part of the sound. You also will not be able to check the battery percentage and will have to go off the audio prompts it gives you. These also do not have noise-cancelling capabilities (which I honestly wouldnâ€™t expect at the low price).So, hereâ€™s where Iâ€™m taking off one starâ€¦the sound. Iâ€™m not an audiophile. I donâ€™t typically listen to music so the majority of my use is podcasts, audiobooks, or YT/Twitch vids. The sound is a bit muted (â€¦not an audiophile) and not quite as clear as my Pros. For that reason, I likely will not use them unless I need to charge both my Pro earbuds at the same timeâ€¦and both my Jabraâ€™s are dead, haha. They would be fine in a pinch, but not something I would choose if my Pros are available.I also cannot speak to the battery life as I havenâ€™t used them for more than a couple minutes, but what they promise (32 hours) is extremely impressive. I ended up giving them to my daughter to use as she only has over the ear headphones. I will say itâ€™s a great first set of earbuds for kids as you do get a lot of great features in a lower priced set.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superior Sound and Comfort in a Compact Package!
author: Pobles
content: The JLab Go Air Pop True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds have completely exceeded my expectations! From their sleek design to their exceptional sound quality, these earbuds are a true game-changer in the world of wireless audio.First and foremost, the sound quality is outstanding. With Bluetooth 5.1 connection and three EQ sound settings (Signature, Balanced, Bass Boost), I can customize my listening experience to suit my preferences perfectly. Whether I'm in the mood for crisp vocals, balanced tones, or powerful bass, these earbuds deliver every time.The dual-connect feature is a fantastic addition, allowing for seamless connectivity and ensuring that I never miss a beat. Whether I'm using one earbud for calls or both for immersive music listening, the connection remains stable and reliable.The IPX4 sweat resistance is a lifesaver during intense workouts or outdoor activities. I never have to worry about sweat or rain damaging my earbuds, giving me peace of mind to focus on my fitness goals.Comfort is another highlight of these earbuds. They fit snugly in my ears without causing any discomfort, even during extended wear. Plus, the charging case is compact and lightweight, making it easy to carry around wherever I go.Overall, the JLab Go Air Pop True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds are a phenomenal choice for anyone in need of high-quality audio on the go. Whether you're working out, commuting, or just relaxing at home, these earbuds deliver superior sound and comfort in a compact package. Highly recommended for their exceptional performance and value!

content: Where do I even start! Coming from airpods, switching to android and getting raycons then subsequently losing them- these are amazing.
